main event: A military officer observed a white light object that increased in intensity and then suddenly extinguished itself in the northern sky over Fort Benning, Georgia on February 27, 1965.
interesting points: The object appeared slightly larger than the largest visible star and was located approximately 900 trail down toward the northwest and somewhat to the north of the observer.
As the object approached the ground, it suddenly emitted a bluish-white glow and traveled about 10 miles in the span of about thirty seconds, then the light went out.
The smoke trail remained visible for about 30 minutes until dissipated by the wind.
Another officer who was nearby also observed the object.
The observation was reported to the Office of the Deputy Chief of Staff, Intelligence on March 17, 1965.
result: The object was likely a satellite re-entry or meteor, but the unusual features of the trail could not be otherwise identified.
sighted object: a white light object that increased in intensity and then suddenly extinguished itself
witnesses: Captain Howard R. Mosley and another unidentified officer
